title: Can I self-publish my book and then sell it to a commercial publisher later? - Quora

response.answer_text: You can try and sell a self published book to a publisher but usually they want you to go through an agent. And many agents and publishers don’t want to work with self published authors. Actually if you do your homework and market your book you’ll make more money selling it yourself and have an agent.

Depends on the publisher. If it’s super successful as a self-published book, it’s likely someone will want to share rights to it or turn it into a series. I think the series way is the most likely way to be signed into a publisher as a self-published person. If a self-published is successful for the first installation, it’s likely readers will want to buy the next in the series.

That will depend on the publisher. Each one has different requirements. Some may only want new work. But if your self-published book is popular they may want it so that they can make money off of it. Just make sure you check their guidelines before submitting.
Yes you can, but the offer should be really attractive. Before contacting any commercial publisher you have to think why would he be interested in your book
